sponsor.partnerMessage: NorthWest Arkansas Community College (NWACC) provides career training in various industries, including retail and supplier analysis, bicycle assembly and repair, integrated design, skilled trades, and many others. Advance your career by visiting www.nwacc.edu/Workforce

posts.title: #NWAChampionship & BITE Experience Tickets Go On Sale Jun 6
posts.content:
The Walmart #NWAChampionship presented by P&G will bring 144 of the world’s best female golfers to Pinnacle Country Club in Rogers to compete for a $2.3m purse this fall, Sep 23 – Oct 1, as well as an exciting lineup of community events, including a 5k race, food festival, guided bike rides, and more.

  • Local flavors: The tournament’s onsite food festival, BITE Experience @ the LPGA, will return as part of the #NWAChampionship, from Sep 29 until Oct 1, with each day featuring a culinary experience that highlights a variety of diverse-owned local restaurants and eateries.
  • For a run: The 5k @ the LPGA benefiting Mercy will return to the Walmart AMP on Saturday, Sep 23, and local companies are encouraged to participate in the corporate challenge for the title of Fittest and Fastest Office in NWA—more race information to come.

Over 750 volunteers are needed to make #NWAChampionship Week possible. Volunteer registration and ticket sales open next Tuesday, Jun 6.

posts.title: It's Time For Mudtown Days In Lowell
posts.content:
A 45-year tradition, Lowell will host its annual Mudtown Days at Ward Nail Park, including car shows, an ATV mud run, kids pageants, and plenty more to enjoy, and a carnival from May 31 to Jun 3.

  • Get muddy: Watch ATV drivers sling mud, explore hotrods during the Mudtown Days Car Show, and enjoy food trucks and free live music by Mark Wills on Jun 2 and Heath Sanders and Pam Tillis on Jun 3.
  • Family fun: There will be fun for the whole family to enjoy, along with prizes to be won, carnival rides, inflatables and games, and contests to enter, like a mud run, fishing derby, and Little Mr. and Miss Lowell and Tiny Tots Pageants.

Learn more about Mudtown Days HERE.

posts.title: Community Created and Community Driven Sustainability
posts.content:
There's a better way to dispose of all those leftover food scraps from your Memorial Day cookout. Ozark Compost's convenient compost pickup is driving positive environmental impacts and has already diverted over 80,000 lbs of food waste from Northwest Arkansas's landfills.

  • Convenient composting: With easy-to-follow compost guides, customer support, and text notifications, composting could not be easier. Fill your 5-gal bucket with compostable items, and OCS will pick it up and deliver a clean one weekly or bi-weekly. You can even receive givebacks for garden use.
  • Conscious consumption: Include a ground or whole-bean Airship coffee subscription with your deliveries, and shop other eco-friendly, zero-waste products on Ozark Compost's online store.

The first 10 NWA Daily readers to sign up will receive a free month of bi-weekly pickups and a refillable coffee canister if you add a coffee subscription, Use code OCS2023 or click HERE.

posts.title: ArDOT Discusses New Highway Through NWA
posts.content:
The Arkansas Department of Transportation has released preliminary findings of the Western North-South Connector Study and will host public involvement meetings to further the proposal to add a north-south highway corridor through western Benton County.

  • Making connections: The plan would likely utilize existing roadways, upgrading smaller roads and connecting segments to create a continuous route for safe and efficient north-south bound travel between the growing communities of Gravette, Centerton, Bentonville, Highfill, and Tontitown.
  • Public input: There are currently no state funds available nor state projects planned for this corridor in the near future. However, information gathered from the public involvement meetings on Jun 5-7 will guide future planning and coordination with local communities.

Find more information and a short video explaining the project HERE.

posts.title: Get Your 80's-90's Vibes On During Fayetteville's First Thursday
posts.content:
Unleash all of your 80’s & 90’s nostalgia during Fayetteville‘s “Throw Back Thursday” themed First Thursday on Jun 1 at the Downtown Square from 5:30-9p.

  • We Built This City: First Thursday on the Square is an annual event series by Experience Fayetteville intended to gather the community around the combination of music, food, art, and fun! This month's presenting sponsor is CACHE.
  • Gettin Jiggy Wit It: The arts and music celebration will include a diverse lineup of art installations, a vintage market, food trucks, a Slow Roll group bike ride with Trailblazers & Bike Fayetteville, and live music from School of Rock, The Juice, and Ultra Suede.

Find all the details for June’s First Thursday HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• 🏀 Make the team: Only two days left to get the $395 early bird price for RYG Basketball Camp, a game-changing training opportunity for 5th-8th grade athletes from July 24-28. Get a free preview of camp HERE.*
  • 🍽️ At the table: Help Arvest Bank fight hunger in our local community during the 13th annual Million Meals campaign.*
  • 🧹 Clean home, happy heart! Reach out to NWA Cleaners to get your home or Airbnb cleaned. Get a quote HERE.*
  • 🎂 One hundred candles: Right on the heels of Memorial Day, WWII veteran Chet Nordling of Rogers celebrates his 100th birthday today!
  • 🏊🏽‍♀️ In the shallows: It's pool season! Check out 40/29's list of local public pools now open for the summer!
  • 📅 Local happenings: Explore upcoming events mentioned in the newsletter, or post your own HERE!
